required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-label, Non-randomized, Parallel Group Study in Subjects With Mild and Moderate Hepatic Insufficiency and Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Compare the Pharmacokinetic Profiles of a Single Dose of Ferriprox® in Subjects With Impaired Hepatic Function and Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-center, non-randomized, open-label, single-dose, parallel group study to determine the effect of impaired hepatic function on the PK of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite following a single oral dose of 33mg/kg Ferriprox®.

detailed_description.textblock: Post-marketing study to evaluate the effect of impaired hepatic function on the pharmacokinetics (PK) of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite and on the safety of Ferriprox® in subjects with mild and moderate hepatic impairment as compared to healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Cmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal hepatic function, mild hepatic impairment, or moderate hepatic impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Tmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal hepatic function, mild hepatic impairment, or moderate hepatic impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-∞ for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: AUC (area under the curve) from zero to infinity was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal hepatic function, mild hepatic impairment, or moderate hepatic impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: T1/2 for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: T1/2 was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal hepatic function, mild hepatic impairment, or moderate hepatic impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.

primary_outcome.measure: CumAe for Urine Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative amount of deferiprone and deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide excreted in the urine. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose, and 0-2, 2-4, 4-8, 8-12 ,and 12- 24 hours post-dose. Note: For unknown reasons, the urine samples for one subject in the moderate hepatic failure group had low or zero volume and there were no measurable levels of deferiprone or its metabolite in any of the samples. Accordingly, the urine PK results were derived both with and without this subject's data, and are here presented without them (i.e., N=6 rather than 7).

primary_outcome.measure: Fe% for Urine Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative fraction of Ferriprox dose excreted in urine as deferiprone or deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose, and 0-2, 2-4, 4-8, 8-12 ,and 12- 24 hours post-dose. Note: For unknown reasons, the urine samples for one subject in the moderate hepatic failure group had low or zero volume and there were no measurable levels of deferiprone or its metabolite in any of the samples. Accordingly, the urine PK results were derived both with and without this subject's data, and are here presented without them (i.e., N=6 rather than 7).

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Ferriprox in Subjects With or Without Hepatic Impairment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of dosing until 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced adverse events following a single dose of Ferriprox, between the time of dosing and the follow-up visit (including any changes of clinical significance in physical examinations, vital signs, 12-lead ECG, and clinical laboratory tests).

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers with normal hepatic function received a single 33 mg/kg dose of Ferriprox®.
Subjects with mild hepatic failure as defined by the Child-Pugh Class C: 5-6 points received a single 33 mg/kg dose of Ferriprox®.
Subjects with moderate hepatic failure as defined by the Child-Pugh Class B: 7-9 points received a single 33 mg/kg dose of Ferriprox®.

group.title: Normal Hepatic Function (Healthy Volunteers)
group.description: Healthy volunteers with normal hepatic function. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.

group.title: Mild Hepatic Failure
group.description: Mild hepatic impairment as defined by Child-Pugh Class C: 5-6 points. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.

group.title: Moderate Hepatic Failure
group.description: Moderate hepatic impairment as defined by Child-Pugh Class : 7-9 points. All subjects received a single 33 mg/kg oral dose of deferiprone.

group.title: Normal Hepatic Function (Healthy Volunteers)
group.description: Healthy volunteers with normal hepatic function

group.title: Mild Hepatic Failure
group.description: Mild hepatic failure as defined by Child-Pugh Class C: 5-6 points

group.title: Moderate Hepatic Failure
group.description: Moderate hepatic failure as defined by Child-Pugh Class B: 7-9 points

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Cmax for Serum Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
outcome.description: Cmax was assessed over a 24-hour interval for analyses of deferiprone and its 3-O-glucuronide metabolite in subjects with normal hepatic function, mild hepatic impairment, or moderate hepatic impairment. Blood samples were obtained prior to dosing and at 0.25, 0.50, 0.75, 1, 1.33, 1.66, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose.
outcome.population: The PK Analysis Set consisted of all subjects who had sufficient data to derive at least one PK parameter

outcome.title: CumAe for Urine Deferiprone and Deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide
outcome.description: Cumulative amount of deferiprone and deferiprone 3-O-glucuronide excreted in the urine. Urine samples were collected at the intervals of -2 to 0 hours pre-dose, and 0-2, 2-4, 4-8, 8-12 ,and 12- 24 hours post-dose. Note: For unknown reasons, the urine samples for one subject in the moderate hepatic failure group had low or zero volume and there were no measurable levels of deferiprone or its metabolite in any of the samples. Accordingly, the urine PK results were derived both with and without this subject’s data, and are here presented without them (i.e., N=6 rather than 7).
outcome.population: The PK Analysis Set consisted of all subjects who had sufficient data to derive at least one PK parameter. The data of one subject in the moderate hepatic failure group were dropped due to low or zero volume of urine samples.

reported_events.desc: Safety data were collected from the time of dosing up to the follow-up visit 48 hours post-dose

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor retained title to and the right to publish all documentation, records, raw data, specimens or other work product generated in connection with the trial. Such publications shall not be made without the prior written consent of Sponsor. Neither Party will use the other Party's name in connection with any publication or promotion without the other Party's prior written consent. However, Sponsor has the right to publish appropriate information in order to satisfy regulatory requirements.
